thread.title: What to Watch on Sunday: Selleck in 9th ‘Jesse Stone’ movie
thread.title_full: What to Watch on Sunday: Selleck in 9th ‘Jesse Stone’ movie

author:
Brooke Cain 
bcain@newsobserver.com
title: What to Watch on Sunday: Selleck in 9th ‘Jesse Stone’ movie
text:
Order Reprint of this Story 
Jesse Stone: Lost in Paradise (9 p.m., Hallmark) – Tom Selleck returns for his ninth in the Jesse Stone movie series, based on books by Robert Parker. This time, Paradise police chief Stone serves as a consultant on an unsolved murder case in Boston. Though it’s widely believed the murder was committed by an incarcerated serial killer, Jesse suspects another killer is at large and is hell-bent on bringing him to justice. Also stars William Devane, Gloria Reuben, Leslie Hope and Luke Perry. Also on . . . 
NC Bookwatch (Noon, UNC-TV) – Martin Harmon talks about “Charles ‘Lefty’ Driesell: A Basketball Legend.” 
The Simpsons (8 p.m., Fox) – Homer and Lisa hide in the attic while former Halloween pop-up employees – angry at Homer, who cost them their jobs – invade the Simpsons’ home. 
The Walking Dead (9 p.m., AMC) – A new problem arises for the Alexandrians (like, thousands of zombies lured their way by a mysterious horn blower, perhaps??). 
The Leftovers (9 p.m., HBO) – Laurie and Tom’s work to rescue lost souls takes a toll on them. 
The Good Wife (9:30 p.m., CBS) – Lucca and Alicia collaborate on a complicated case involving the dealer of a designer drug. Also, Eli wants Alicia and Veronica to participate in a mother-daughter cooking show. 
Quantico (10 p.m., ABC) – Alex finds a clue that puts the innocence of one of her closest classmates into question. Related content
